none: Letter to Louis L. McInnis from Granville Pierce, February 22, 1887
Letter to Louis L. McInnis from Granville Pierce, February 22, 1887
Box 1 Louis L. McInnis Papers/Box 1 Folder 24 Louis L. McInnis Papers

en: A memorandum from Granville T. Pierce, Town Clerk of South Britain, Connecticut, to Professor Louis L. McInnis at College Station, Texas, requesting assistance in acquiring Native American stone artifacts for his collection and comparative study. Pierce seeks specimens including arrowheads, spear points, scrapers, drills, and ornamental stones, with particular interest in rare colored examples and large lance heads, offering compensation through various means including relics, books, minerals, or cash.

body.value:
MEMORANDUM.

Feb 22nd 1887.

| From | To | | :--- | :--- | | GRANVILLE T. PIERCE,
Town Clerk's Office,
So. BRITAIN, CONN. | Prof Louis L. McInnis
College Station
Texas. |

Dear Sir :

Being interested in Archaeology & a collector of
Indian relics, particularly of Stone I desire to obtain
examples from various locolities for comparison & study
I have nothing from Texas, but should much pleased
to procure some specimens. And I will gladly
compensate any one who can furnish good spear &
arrow heads Scrapers, drills Knives, or ornamental
stones, &c in good relics, books, minerals, cash in
short in any possible manner most agreeable to
the gentleman who thus can favor me –

All classes of relics are very acceptable but I am most
anxious to procure fine spear & arrow heads, particularly
those of various colors & minerals. Specimens of green
or red color are rare here, & I should value any such
very highly. Another object of search is a large spear
or lance head, a very long one is much desired –

If you are able & willing to assist me I shall gladly
repay you in the best manner I can – but if you are
not able to do so, it is possible that you can name
another gentleman who can give it his attention
Please favor me with a reply & Oblige
Yours very respectfully
Granville T Pierce.
Yale Class of '55
